creator: katkere@praja.com
text:
Tomcat 3.3 provides two system properties that can be used to add to the jar 
files automatically added to apps and common ClassLoaders from Tomcat directory 
structure. There are legitimate reasons why one might want to do it:

- Many do not like adding application jars to an installed product's lib
- Symbolic links are not cross platform (and ant doesn't support it, and we 
still end up with application jars in Tomcat lib)

How about providing two similar properties in Catalina? 
org.apache.catalina.common.classpath and org.apache.catalina.shared.classpath? 
(Can't we all get along?)

Created attachment 471
Attaching suggested patch to Bootstrap.java (diff from Sept 1 nightly).
creator: katkere@praja.com

text:
Classloading and class overriding is a complex issue. One of the issues with 
that kind of change is that you end up not knowing from where your classes have 
been loaded (and obviously you can also get some funky class overriding if your 
classpath sys property includes your put-all-the-jars-there directory).

If you need the feature, it's easy enough to apply the patch in your own 
repository, but that's a feature which IMO would lead to even more user 
problems dealing with classloading.

Craig: I'm not totally against the patch, I just feel that it's not a very good 
idea. If you're in favor of this patch, mail me, or just apply the patch 
yourself.
creator: remm@apache.org

text:

particular ClassLoader via system property?). 

I knew I shouldn't have mentioned TC3.3! (Just kidding).

text:
"you can also get some funky class overriding if your 
classpath sys property includes your put-all-the-jars-there directory"

The patch does not automatically include all the jars from a particular 
directory. *You* need to put it explicitly into the system property.
Thanks for the patch.  This is a very important feature in 3.3.
creator: Keith@Apache.org
Adnan.Music@ssmb.com.au
text:
Another benefit of having alternative method to add  classes to the Common 
Classloader and Apps Classloader (using system properties) is
ability to use shared tomcat installation by multiple developers.

Since shared classes at the moment have to be placed under  
$CATALINA_HOME/shared - you end up with an union of shared classes for all 
developers for all web applications they are working on. 

This is ugly but so far it works, but  what do you do when two developers need 
different version of a shared library?
You have to create another tomcat 4 installation. You may then as well have one 
tomcat installation per developer
